text:
Sir Eric Paul McClintock (13 September 1918 – 27 March 2018) was an Australian former public servant and businessman. He was born in Gulgong, New South Wales.
McClintock was known for serving as Chairman of Woolworths Limited from 1980 to 1987. He was a speech writer for future Prime Minister John McEwen, then Minister for Trade, and served as First Assistant Secretary, Department of Trade 1958-61.
He was NSW campaign chair for the Australian Prospectors & Miners' Hall of Fame (now defunct).
McClintock died in Sydney on 27 March 2018 at the age of 99.

annotations.surface_form: Australian Prospectors & Miners' Hall of Fame
